intro: Centaurea concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, bright yellow flowers with reddish or purple markings. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. Centaurea concinna is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
